questions.question: How many kinds of stuck at faults are there ?

explanations.b: Stuck-at faults are classified into two types: stuck-at-0 and stuck-at-1, where a signal line is stuck at either 0 or 1, regardless of the input.

questions.question: In an XOR gate with inputs I1 and I2, if there is a stuck at 1 at I1, then the output is

explanations.c: With a stuck-at-1 fault at I1, the XOR gate behaves as if I1 is always 1. The output then depends on the negation of I2 (i.e., ~I2)

questions.question: Stuck at faults can occur at

explanations.c: Stuck-at faults can occur both at the input lines (where signals are fixed at 0 or 1) and the output lines (where the output is fixed at 0 or 1 regardless of the inputs)

questions.question: A circuit with n lines can have how many stuck line combinations

explanations.d: For a circuit with n lines, there are three possibilities for each line: the line can be stuck at 0, stuck at 1, or functioning normally. Thus, there are 3^n combinations, and subtracting 1 accounts for the case where no line is stuck.
